sources.title: Them (1954)
sources.description: Them! is a 1954 black-and-white science fiction giant monster film starring James Whitmore, Edmund Gwenn, Joan Weldon, and James Arness. The story followsÂ  a group of scientists and law enforcement officials investigate a series of mysterious deaths and destruction in the New Mexico desert, where they discover that atomic testing has caused common ants to mutate into giant, man-eating monsters. The story follows their efforts to stop the ants, which have escaped and threaten civilization, culminating in a battle in the storm drain system of Los Angeles.

sources.title: Them!
sources.description: The earliest atomic tests in New Mexico cause common ants to mutate into giant man-eating monsters that threaten civilization.

metadata.Plot: In the New Mexico desert, Police Sgt. Ben Peterson and his partner find a child wandering in the desert and soon they discover that giant ants are attacking the locals. FBI agent Robert Graham teams up with Ben and with the support of Dr. Harold Medford and his daughter Dr. Patricia 'Pat' Medford, they destroy the colony of ants in the middle of the desert. Dr. Harold Medford explains that the atomic testing in 1945 developed the dangerous mutant ants. But they also discover that two queen ants have flown away to Los Angeles and they are starting a huge colony in the underground flood control tunnels of that city. When a mother reports that her two children are missing, the team begin searching for them. Will they arrive in time to save the children and destroy the colony?
